alert.note: Alert for Erie; Lucas; Ottawa (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Lakeshore Flood Watch issued March 02 at 2:22PM EST until March 04 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...LAKESHORE FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Significant lakeshore flooding possible. * WHERE...Lucas, Ottawa and Erie Counties, including The Islands of Lake Erie. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads may be closed. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Some shoreline erosion may occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...East to northeast gales of around 35 knots with gusts to 50 knots and waves of 6 to 10 feet are anticipated in the western basin of Lake Erie Friday afternoon and evening. As a result, water levels at Toledo may rise above 72 inches above low water datum late Friday afternoon into Friday evening. For Erie County, the greatest chance of lakeshore flooding will be in the northwestern portion of the county, including Kelleys Island.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
